dt-api.name: row().child().remove()
dt-api.summary: Destroy child row(s) for the selected parent row

type.description: Remove child row(s) from display and release any allocated memory

dt-api.description:
This method is used to remove child row(s) from a parent row, removing them from the displayed table (if they are currently displayed) and releasing the memory allocated for these rows.
Please note that this method is only available when `-api row().child()` is called with a parameter set. This is because `-api row().child()` will return the child rows if called with no parameters, which is either a `-type Dom` object or `-type undefined` (prior to DataTables 3, `-type jQuery` would be returned). When called with a parameter `-api row().child()` returns a `-type DataTables.Api` instance. If you need to display a child row without any parameters being set use `-api row().child.show()`.
Unlike many of the other methods which manipulate the DataTable, this method does not require `-api draw()` to be called immediately after. The child row(s) are removed from table without requiring that DataTables redraw.
